summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Match Point
Review Date: 2013/10/31
Store: Brian Cox  (Actor),     Jonathan Rhys Meyers  (Actor),     Woody Allen  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
Product Description: ["For the first time in his long career, writer-director Woody Allen takes his cast and crew to London, and the European location breathes new life into the normally Manhattan-centric auteur. Director Woody Allen Star Scarlett Johansson, Emily Mortimer, Jonathan Rhys-Myers, Matthew Goode, Brian Cox, Penelope Wilton, Paul Kaye, John Fortune, Rupert Penry-Jones, Anthony O'Donnell, Special Features: Anamorphic Widescreen - 1.85 Audio: Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono - English Subtitles - English (SDH), English, French, Spanish Year of Release: 2005."]
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Mystery & Suspense', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Woody Allen, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Scarlett Johansson, Brian Cox, Matthew Goode, Emily Mortimer', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 1.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 4 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2246557', 'Director': 'Woody Allen', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 4 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 23, 2012', 'Actors': 'Brian Cox, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Matthew Goode, Emily Mortimer, Scarlett Johansson', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'Paramount Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This is a terrific movie.  JRM is so compelling!  One finds oneself wanting the bad guy to win!  Wonderful scenes shot in London along the Thames riverbank and around town in general.  Country house weekend is totally believable and authentic as are all of the characters.  Five stars for everything!  I could have watched these characters for another three hours and not been bored!
Review Title: Better than Hitchcock!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/03/16
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Bora Egemen'], 'Producers': ['Koray Şahin', 'Fırat Doğu Parlak'], 'Starring': ['Kıvanç Tatlıtuğ', 'Büşra Develi', 'Yücel Erten'], 'Studio': ['25 Film']}
Review Text: You will be taken on a father and son roller-coaster of emotions.  I was left breathless at the end.  Box of tissues for this one; yet not mushy.  Each emotion expressed by Kivanc Tatlitug was authentic and believable. Well produced,  the locations and details made this endeavor enticing.  Certainly worthy of an Art House release.
Review Title: Wonderful well told story!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2021/02/06
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Loncraine'], 'Producers': ['Debra Seigel', 'Liza Chasin', 'Eric Fellner', 'Mary Richards'], 'Starring': ['Kirsten Dunst', 'Paul Bettany', 'Sam Neill'], 'Studio': ['UNIVERSAL PAY TELEVISION']}
Review Text: As a Brit, whats not to like.  A stellar cast; well-written and glorious shots of The Dorchester Park Lane, London in general and Brighton by the sea.  Paul Bettany as a tennis pro was very believable - good moves on the court.  Sam Neill's American accent was truly truly bad!  James Macavoy's English accent; excellent!  What can I say, it's a romp; but a good one.  John Favreau calls out the name of Bettany's real-life wife as he talks in his sleep; coincidence or great adlib; I don't know but very funny!
Review Title: PAUL BETTANY AND SCENES OF LONDON AND BRIGHTON!!!  A WIN WIN!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Dirty John
Review Date: 2021/02/06
Categories: Drama
Product Description: ['Dirty John: The Betty Broderick Story," the second installment of the "Dirty John" anthology series, is based on another epic true tale of love gone wrong -- a story that spans the 1960s to the \'80s, through the breakdown of a marriage that Oprah deemed one of "America\'s messiest divorces" even before it ended in double homicide.']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeffrey Reiner', 'Maggie Kiley', 'Kat Candler', 'Alexandra Cunningham', 'Shannon Kohli', 'Meera Menon'], 'Producers': ['Christopher Argentieri', 'Nan Bernstein Freed', 'Connie Britton', 'Christopher G. Cowen'], 'Starring': ['Julia Garner', 'Juno Temple', 'Jean Smart']}
Review Text: This was an excellent series.  Having read everything there was to read; and had seen a made for TV movie I was convinced Dan Broderick was the injured party who had a shrew of a wife.  This series showed an equal share of blame; if the script was taken from transcripts.  He was no perfect angel nor was his Secretary/second wife.  If Betty had been able to get good psych help and meds she would have had better control of her emotions.  This was a crime of passion for sure; Betty was driven over a cliff because Dan knew just how to get to her.  It's a tough watch but so worth seeing. Amanda Peet is astoundingly good and Christian Slater gives self-righteous smarm a whole new meaning.  See it; you WILL binge!
Review Title: DAN BRODERICK WAS NOT AN INNOCENT PARTY AS I HAD THOUGHT
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2021/07/02
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Damian Harris'], 'Producers': ['Ellen Collett'], 'Starring': ['John Heard', 'Goldie Hawn', 'Ashley Peldon'], 'Studio': ['Touchstone Pictures']}
Review Text: This is one terrific movie. Mystery and twist after twist. Great cast too. This movie stands up as well today as it did when it was originally released.
Review Title: WE WERE ALL DECEIVED!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analyzed purchase history reveals a strong preference for emotionally impactful dramas, typically featuring high-caliber actors and well-crafted storytelling. Consistently high ratings (ranging from 4.5 to 5.0) illustrate a discerning viewer who values character development and engaging narratives. The individual favors films with compelling themes, often centered around moral complexities, personal relationships, and mysteries, indicating a taste for both depth and intensity in storytelling.

Recurring references to specific locations, particularly London, suggest an appreciation for settings that enhance the plot’s authenticity. This preference aligns with a desire for authenticity in character portrayals, as seen in emotional performances that evoke genuine reactions. The viewer clearly enjoys productions that provoke thought and reflection, evidenced by their responses to various storylines.

Quality emerges as a priority, with a consistent engagement with well-produced content that features top-tier casts. Price sensitivity appears low, as the customer’s focus is primarily on quality and entertainment value rather than cost affordability. Additionally, their engagement with a mix of contemporary and classic films demonstrates a broad and varied taste in cinematic experiences.

In summary, this individual exhibits a deep-seated appreciation for cinematic storytelling characterized by strong emotional elements, quality performances, and complex character arcs, firmly aligning with high-rated dramas and thought-provoking narratives.

target_interaction.title: A very unique movie!
target_interaction.text: Well acted, beautiful scenery and engaging story.
